intro: Pieris japonica subsp. formosa, commonly known as the Japanese pieris, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan and Korea. It is characterized by its attractive, glossy, dark green leaves that turn reddish in autumn. The plant produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers in early spring, which are highly ornamental. It thrives in partial shade and well-drained, acidic soil, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Its foliage and flowering habits make it a valuable addition to both ornamental and ecological landscapes.
